question: 伴う
sourceMnemonic: Because the hiragana ends with an <ja>う</ja> sound, you know this word is a verb. The kanji itself means <kanji>accompany</kanji> and the verb vocab version is <vocabulary>to accompany</vocabulary>. This can be used both literally and figuratively.
sourceReadingMnemonic: You need <vocabulary>to accompany</vocabulary> your friend, so to call out to them you yell "<reading><ja>友</ja>, NOW</reading>!" (<ja>ともなう</ja>) to command them to come near you to accompany you to somewhere else.
